---
title: "R Notebook"
output: html_notebook
---


```{r}
require(ggplot2)
require(ggpubr)
require(dplyr)

prob_cmp <- read.csv("problem_cmp.csv")

colnames(prob_cmp) <- c("ts", "gc", "nogc")
ggplot(prob_cmp) +
  geom_line(aes(x=ts, y=gc), color="blue") + 
  geom_line(aes(x=ts, y=nogc), color="red") +
  coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0.99, 1)) +
  labs(x="Tempo de Resposta (us)", y="Função de Distribuição Cumulativa")+ 
  theme_pubclean()
```

Add a new chunk by clicking the *Insert Chunk* button on the toolbar or by pressing *Ctrl+Alt+I*.

When you save the notebook, an HTML file containing the code and output will be saved alongside it (click the *Preview* button or press *Ctrl+Shift+K* to preview the HTML file).
